intro: Neowimmeria niihauensis, commonly known as Niihau sandalwood, is a rare and endemic species native to the Hawaiian island of Niihau. It is a member of the Santalaceae family and is characterized by its small, woody shrub form with fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in dry, coastal habitats and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native island. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect this rare botanical species.
